top_categories.workout_context: The GRiT Adventure's Washington Cascades, Mountain gravel forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 65 miles.
85ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
At The GRiT Adventure, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
Race-pace efforts that mimic The GRiT Adventure's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before July.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of The GRiT Adventure. Train it until it feels boring.
5,500ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
5,500ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At The GRiT Adventure, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
65 miles on Washington Cascades gravel burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
Low-cadence force work for 5,500ft of climbing. The slow, grinding ascents where you can't spin—you push.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.
Smooth pedaling at 65 miles saves muscle. Bad technique at mile 10 is invisible. At mile 80 it's a cramp.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for The GRiT Adventure’s 65 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at The GRiT Adventure. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at The GRiT Adventure requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on washington cascades gravel to build confidence. Expect: washington cascades, mountain gravel, pacific northwest.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, TT Threshold, and Over Under to prepare you for 65 miles of washington cascades gravel in Snoqualmie Pass, WA.
